channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Summer lovin’, put on blast: Can CEOs stop behaving badly?
item.description: Is it that CEOs are behaving more poorly or just that we just have greater means to catch them in the act?

item.title: Israel Steps Up Attacks on Gaza City Ahead of a Planned Wider Offensive
item.description: The Israeli military destroyed a landmark building after saying it had taken control of almost half of the city, where hundreds of thousands of civili...

item.title: An Indiana lawyer named Mark Zuckerberg is suing Meta, saying his Facebook pages keep getting disabled because he was ‘impersonating a celebrity’
item.description: Despite Zuckerberg being locked out of his account for months at a time, Meta kept the $11,000 the lawyer spent on advertising for his firm, according...

item.title: A Rapid U.S. Military Buildup in the Caribbean: What to Know
item.description: The United States has deployed eight warships, several surveillance planes and one attack submarine to the region as tensions with Venezuela grow.

item.title: Federal Report on Drinking Is Withdrawn
item.description: The upcoming U.S. Dietary Guidelines will instead be influenced by a competing study, favored by industry, which found that moderate alcohol consumpti...

item.title: Anthropic Agrees to Pay $1.5 Billion to Settle Lawsuit With Book Authors
item.description: The settlement is the largest payout in the history of U.S. copyright cases and could lead more A.I. companies to pay rights holders for use of their ...

item.title: How to watch Friday’s streaming-exclusive NFL game live online for free—and without cable
item.description: This season's Taylor Swift-watch gets underway.

item.title: Paramount’s new CEO tells employees to return to office full-time or quit ahead of layoffs
item.description: Employees who don’t want to comply have until mid-September to take a buyout.

item.title: Is the Fed ready to go big? Analysts debate jumbo rate cut after soft jobs data
item.description: A half-point cut is “now in play,” some analysts say.

item.title: Trump’s Immigration Policy Is a Factor in Slow Job Growth
item.description: Economic data suggests labor supply and immigration changes are affecting job growth. The Federal Reserve can’t fix that, but Trump can.

item.title: Lisbon Funicular Was Inspected Hours Before Deadly Crash
item.description: Investigators are searching for the cause of the crash that killed 16 people, with questions focusing on a possible failure of the cable that kept the...

item.title: A Rapid U.S. Military Buildup in the Caribbean: What to Know
item.description: The United States has deployed eight warships, several surveillance planes and one attack submarine to the region as tensions with Venezuela grow.

item.title: Duchess of Kent, Royal Who Comforted a Wimbledon Loser, Dies at 92
item.description: A member of an aristocratic family, she married the Duke of Kent, a cousin of Queen Elizabeth II.

item.title: How a Top Secret SEAL Team 6 Mission Into North Korea Fell Apart
item.description: The 2019 operation, greenlit by President Trump, sought a strategic edge. It left unarmed North Koreans dead.
